H0.text: The automobiles are identical is the result of using interchangeable parts to manufacture automobiles.

H1.text: The automobiles wear out quickly as a result of using interchangeable parts to manufacture automobiles.

H2.text: The automobiles are difficult to design as a result of using interchangeable parts to manufacture them.

H3.text: The automobiles can be produced on an assembly line is the result of using interchangeable parts to manufacture automobiles.

A4.text: During the early 19th century, the development of machine tools such as the screwâ€‘cutting lathe, metal planer, and milling machine, and of toolpath control via jigs and fixtures, provided the prerequisites for the modern assembly line by making interchangeable parts a practical reality.
